First Blog Post! Learning React and a simple movie webapp

05 Aug 2021

Recently I thought of getting into web development, picking up a few skills here and there and an easy tech stack to build products I’m thinking of building later. I settled with ReactJS and NextJS. To learn this, I’ll be building a simple clone of hulu.com. It’s still not finished and I hope to finish it later this month after going through a bunch of other tutorials.

code is at: https://github.com/youwillneverafford1bitcoin/huuluu

commit 1: init

  • just basic readme and initial gitignore

commit 2: setup

  • start project with next.js
    • $ npx create-next-app NameOfApp
      • we now have a NameOfApp directory, cd into it, and run the dev server (puts app to http://localhost:3000) with
      • $ npm dev
      • from: https://nextjs.org/learn/basics/create-nextjs-app/setup
      • got an error when I did $ npx create-next-app NameOfApp:
 npm ERR! Unexpected end of JSON input while parsing near '...":"3.0.0","@zeit/ncc"'
 npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
 npm ERR!     /Users/patamata/.npm/_logs/2021-07-28T08_16_02_041Z-debug.log
  • nothing on stackoverflow and github issues helped so I tried deleting the .npm and did the command again, now it works
  • page routing is supported out of the box with next.js and can be seen on /pages with index.js for example representing the index page, creating about.js would be the about page
  • delete package-lock.json and use yarn to get right packages for us
  • $ yarn

commit 3: tailwind and initial build

  • tried a different setup with
  • $ npx create-next-app -e with-tailwindcss
  • anyhow it works and setups up everyything with tailwindcss but anyhow i deleted it and went to the docs instead to try setting it up the longer way
  • add tailwind CSS to project
    • $ npm install -D tailwindcss@latest postcss@latest autoprefixer@latest
    • from: https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/nextjs
    • but I wanted it in yarn so I only took the bolded string
    • $ yarn add -D tailwindcss@latest postcss@latest autoprefixer@latest
    • afterwards, time to create config files (tailwind.config.js & postcss.config.js) with:
    • $ npx tailwindcss init -p
    • we’re still following https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/nextjs
    • w/c next is “Configure Tailwind to remove unused styles in production”
    • where we add to purge: line at tailwind.config.js file the ff:
    • purge: [’./pages/*/.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}’, ‘./components/*/.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}’],
    • purge cleans css we wont use
    • going tangential frm the setup, we add jit to the tailwind.config.js file: mode ‘jit’,
    • back to official setup docs https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/nextjs
    • we’re on “Include Tailwind in your CSS” and we choose the 2nd option “Include Tailwind in your CSS”
    • we just follow it and go to styles/globals.css and replace everything with what’s on the docs
  • $ yarn run dev
  • faced an error on sonething like missing dev, so i added dev on the scripts at package.json but there’s still the error:
sh: next: command not found
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! syscall spawn
npm ERR! file sh
npm ERR! errno ENOENT
npm ERR! @ dev: `next dev`
npm ERR! spawn ENOENT
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the @ dev script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.
  • so I decided to upgrade yarn with $ yarn install and then $ yarn upgrade and now it works I see http://localhost:3000/
  • edited index.js page to just a <h1>let’s goo</h1> to test things out and all’s OK

commit 4: start setup components

  • decided to work on 3 components for the page: header where the activity icons will be such as search, navbar for movie filtering, and results for movies
  • created a directory for components, then made js files for the components like header.js, etc.
  • updated next.config.js to allow images and others
